column4: can you go to 127.0.0.1 served by ubuntu from windows on a VM I wonder .. probably getting further OT here ...
127.0.0.1 is the localhost of whatever machine is currently running. 127.0.0.1 is the virtual machine's localhost, and on the parent server, 127.0.0.1 is localhost for that parent server.
so that would be a no I guess .. hrmph .. yeah, the dialog is starting to look better and better ..
that's the same for every tcp/ip networked device in existence. it's a part of the 802.3 standard.
